page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: Mr Houghton owns 4 farms, Webbs land, Park Place, Cold Harbour and Wickham. Cold Harbour Farm is the only one in our grid square. We interviewed Mr Houghton about this farm. This farm consists of beef cattle, which are bought at eight months, fattened up and slaughtered at Wimborne. Cattle have their morning feed on a regular basis which is at 7.30 a.m. and another feed later in the day. They must also have dry straw and plenty of water. The crop rotation is a 4 year one, a mixture of grass and arable. Two crops of wheat are grown, one of peas and one of barley and then the field is returned to pasture. These crops have to be fertilised with nitrogen, potash and lime and sprayed with pesticides, the turning of this is governed by weather and season.
